Posts.Content: Sep 16, 2008 03:58AM Payne wrote: Thank you guys for some answers. I guess it was because of the size that my Dr went with chemo first. It was almost the size of an orange when I found out that it was cancer!  However the chemo is working! I go for my 4th treatment in the morning. Id say its shrunk by atleast half! I wish my onc. would have told me about the option to freeze my eggs. It all happen so fast though. I found out that it was cancer on 7-10-08 then had my port put in the very next day and my first chemo session 7-15-08. It was like I had no time to process anything. Im glad to hear that others have had children. Gives me hope that one day I can too.
